Description: Tondo and foot sherd of Attic black-figured pottery stemless cup; interior, in tondo, black-figure decoration consisting of Gorgoneion (top of head missing; added red on hair, eyes and tongue); red band around tondo, glazed outside; exterior: glazed with red band at centre of stem; outside of foot reserved.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Boston II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum USA, Fasc. 19, Museum of Fine Arts, Boston (p. 50, pl. 109, no. 18)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 235, no. 208)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1548) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4782 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
